meanings.definition: Treatment or circumstances that cause one to feel shame or loss of dignity.
meanings.sent1: Being laughed at in front of everyone was a great indignity.
meanings.sent2: Experiencing disrespect in public is a form of indignity.
meanings.sent3: The mix-up at the party was an unexpected indignity.
meanings.sent4: The broken promise felt like an indignity to her trust.
meanings.sent5: The unfair criticism was an unbearable indignity to her self-esteem.

meanings.definition: An act that offends one's dignity or self-respect.
meanings.sent1: Refusing to acknowledge her hard work was a clear indignity.
meanings.sent2: His rude comment was a blatant indignity towards her.
meanings.sent3: The cat's refusal to eat the fancy food was an amusing indignity.
meanings.sent4: The scratched car felt like an indignity to his prized possession.
meanings.sent5: The rejection letter was a harsh indignity to his aspirations.
